com.immortallabs.cardboard.ui
Class CardGraphic

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              com.immortallabs.cardboard.ui.CardGraphic
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class CardGraphic
extends javax.swing.JComponent

The CardGraphic class is used to draw the Cardboard game cards in the GameWindow. It does this by extending Component and overwriting the paint method. This class also contains methods to animate and scale the cards appropriately.

Operations:

  • The CardGraphic class can create a card for the game board.
  • The CardGraphic class can animate itself card.
  • The CardGraphic class can scale the size of itself to fit on the game board.

Version:
1.3, Jan. 3rd, 2008
Author:
Brad Barrows
See Also:
Serialized Form
Version History:

Constructor Detail

CardGraphic

public CardGraphic(Card card,
                   ActionMap actionmap,
                   Natural row,
                   Natural column,
                   GameWindow gamewindow,
                   java.awt.Point drawLocation)
Creates a CardGraphic to represent a card at the position row, column in the game board.

Parameters:
card - the card to represent
actionmap - the ActionMap instance to use
row - the row of the gameboard to place the card
column - the column of the gameboard to place the card
gamewindow - the GameWindow instance to use
drawLocation - the location to draw the card at
See Also:
Card, ActionMap, GameWindow, Natural

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent

scaleTo

public void scaleTo(SetsBoard.ROWS rows)
Scales the size of this CardGraphic to fit on the gameboard with 4,5,6 or 7 rows. This method is called when the number of rows of cards on the gameboard increases. It is used to scale the size of the cards to all fit in the GameWindow.

Parameters:
rows - the number of rows of cards on the gameboard
See Also:
GameWindow
